Thank you! I haven't seen that issue, so I don't know what would cause it. Make sure you have the most recent version of Blender (2.73). I don't think that would be the cause, but it's worth checking.

In Blender, press Ctrl+Alt+U and go to the Input tab. Find 3D View and expand it. Then expand 3D View (Global). At the bottom of that section you can see the hotkey for the Custom Menu. If there is a duplicate (maybe you ran the script twice?), kill one of them and then you can close the Preferences window. If there's only 1, I don't know what to tell you. You could save and close Blender, then reopen it. When you open it again it should have forgotten all about the menu, meaning that you can run that script from a clean slate. Good luck!

nvm, I'l just hand over my generic blender help (based on the difficulties in the thread)..

the camera

in object mode, right click the camera and use the arrows to get it on good angles (use side and top views to get the camera right aswell with num pad key)

to switch from perspective to orthographic and back press num pad 5.

When you think it looks right, dont render, use numpad0 to get a preview.. if its not quite right, you can right click the preview edge and adjust that.

basic object manipulation of relevance

selecting, c for circle selector, b for box selection, a to select/deselect all and L to select the object the mouse is over.

press z to switch to wireframe view (for ease of selection)

joining objects can be with multi-select cmd-j

parenting by selecting the 2 object and cmd-p

s for scaling (press x,y or z to get axis specific)

r for rotation (^^^^^^)

del or x to delete

g to move an object by grabbing...

\*/downloads Blender
